maml:description.maml:para: Blocks access to a file share.
The Block-FileShareAccess cmdlet blocks access to the specified file share for the specified accounts by adding an access-denied access control entry (ACE) to the share's security descriptor.
Specifies an array of account names to block.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a file server on which to set permissions.
Specifies the name of the file share for which the user is being granted access. Because the share name is not a worldwide unique name, use a different parameter set to avoid confusion.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The default is the current session on the local computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.

The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 1: Block file share access --------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Block-FileShareAccess -Name "VMFiles" -AccountName "Contoso\Guest" Confirm Are you sure you want to perform this action? Performing operation 'Modify' on Target 'Contoso-SO,VMFiles'. [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): Y
Name ScopeName AccountName AccessControlType AccessRight ---- --------- ----------- ----------------- ----------- VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Guest Deny Full VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Administrator Allow Full VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Contoso-HV1$ Allow Full VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Contoso-HV2$ Allow Full VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Domain Admins Allow Change

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command blocks the Guest account from accessing VMFiles.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves file share objects and their properties.
The Get-FileShare cmdlet gets objects that correspond to the file shares on the specified server. You must have local administrator credentials on a server to retrieve the objects.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the file server on which the file share is hosted. To obtain a FileServer , use the Get-StorageFileServer cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the file share to get.
Specifies the file sharing protocol of the file shares that this cmdlet gets. The acceptable values for this parameter are: SMB and NFS.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the name of the file share to get.
Specifies the file sharing protocol of the file shares that this cmdlet gets. The acceptable values for this parameter are: SMB and NFS.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specified the volume object that contains the file share to get. To obtain a volume, use the Get-Volume cmdlet.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the name of the file share to get.
Specifies the file sharing protocol of the file shares that this cmdlet gets. The acceptable values for this parameter are: SMB and NFS.
Specifies the storage subsystem from which to get file shares. To obtain a StorageSubsystem object, use the Get-StorageSubSystem cmdlet.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

The default is the current session on the local computer.

If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies a unique ID.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the file server on which the file share is hosted. To obtain a FileServer , use the Get-StorageFileServer cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the file share to get.
Specifies the file sharing protocol of the file shares that this cmdlet gets. The acceptable values for this parameter are: SMB and NFS.
Specifies the storage subsystem from which to get file shares. To obtain a StorageSubsystem object, use the Get-StorageSubSystem cmdlet.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. command:example.maml:title: ------ Example 1: Get all file shares on the local server ------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the file shares on the local server. You must have local administrator permissions on the server to run this command.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get all NFS file shares on the specified file server

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all NFS file shares on the file server named FileServer01. You must have local administrator credentials on the server to run this command. The command gets the file server by using the Get-StorageFileServer cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves an access control entry for the share corresponding to a single account.

The Get-FileShareAccessControlEntry cmdlet retrieves an access control entry for the share corresponding to a single account. You must have local administrator permissions on the specified server to run this cmdlet.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the access control entry for a share on a file server

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the access control entry for the VirtualMachines share on the FileServer01 file server. You must have local administrator permissions on the specified server to run this command. The command uses the Get-StorageFileServer to get the file server.

maml:description.maml:para: Grants access to a file share.
The Grant-FileShareAccess cmdlet grants access to a file share for the specified accounts by adding an Allow access control entry (ACE) to the share's security descriptor.
Specifies the access rights for the accounts. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Full
- Modify
- Read
- Custom
Specifies an array of account names. This cmdlet grants file share access to the account names that you specify.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a file server.

Specifies an array of file share names. This cmdlet grants access to the file share names you specify. Because the file share name is not a worldwide unique name, you can use a different parameter set to avoid confusion.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

- Full

- Read
- Custom

maml:description.maml:para: Revokes access to a file share.
The Revoke-FileShareAccess cmdlet removes the Allow access control entries (ACE) for a trustee from the security descriptor of a specified file share.

If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies an array of account names for which to revoke access.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of unique IDs of file shares for which to revoke access.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies an array of account names for which to revoke access.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a file server.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies an array of file share names for which to revoke access.
Because the share name is not a worldwide unique name, you can use a different parameter set to avoid confusion.
Returns an object representing the item with which you are working. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of unique IDs of file shares for which to revoke access.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

command:example.maml:title: ----------- Example 1: Revoke access to a file share -----------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Revoke-FileShareAccess -Name VMFiles -AccountName "Domain Admins" Confirm Are you sure you want to perform this action? Performing operation 'Modify' on Target 'Contoso-SO,VMFiles'. [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): Y
Name ScopeName AccountName AccessControlType AccessRight ---- --------- ----------- ----------------- ----------- VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Administrator Allow Full VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Contoso-HV1$ Allow Full VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Contoso-HV2$ Allow Full

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command revokes access to the file share named VMFiles.

maml:description.maml:para: Unblocks access to a file share.
The Unblock-FileShareAccess cmdlet removes all of the Deny access control entries (ACE) for the specified trustee from the share's security descriptor.
Specifies the names of accounts to unblock.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies a file server.
Specifies the name of the file share for which the user is being granted access. Because the share name is not a worldwide unique name, use a different parameter set to avoid confusion.

command:example.maml:title: ------------- Example 1: Unblock file share access -------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\>Unblock-FileShareAccess -Name "VMFiles" -AccountName "Guest Users" Confirm Are you sure you want to perform this action? Performing operation 'Modify' on Target 'Contoso-SO,VMFiles'. [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): Y
Name ScopeName AccountName AccessControlType AccessRight ---- --------- ----------- ----------------- ----------- VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Guest Deny Full VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Administrator Allow Full VMFiles Contoso-SO Contoso\Contoso-HV1$ Allow Full

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command unblocks access to VMFiles for the Guest Users account.
